result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas N Lacy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

supervisions.notes: Court grants 3 days sentence credit applied to fine. ($150.00) Remaining balance to be paid at a rate of $35.00 per month commencing 11-01-2022 and each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment entered for non payment.

Costs to be paid with fine payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

supervisions.notes:
Court waives standard court costs. DNA Surcharge to be paid with payment plan listed in Count 2. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas N Lacy

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

3:10 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Thomas N Lacy in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes it has received a completed waiver of right to attorney and plea questionnaire.  Court notes it discussed the matter with the defendant off the record and allowed the defendant time to complete the documents to resolve the matter today. Court reviews the case on the record.  Court confirms with the defendant he would like to resolve the matter and proceed without counsel today.  Court conducts colloquy with the defendant regarding his waiver of right to an attorney.  Court finds the defendant is knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily waiving his right to an attorney.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 2 & 3, Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 2 & 3.  Court orders Counts 1 & 4 be dismissed and read in.  Court also orders cases 22CT146 & 22CT418 be dismissed and read into this case.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 2: 
The Court Orders the Following:

FINE: $379.00;
	
DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 


COUNT 3:
The Court Orders the Following:

COSTS: Waived by the Court;
	
DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture for Counts 2 & 3: Court will award 3 Days Credit, $150.00, to be applied to fine/costs; remainder to be paid at the rate of $35.00 per month commencing 11/01/2022.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Comply with all conditions as set in 22CT146 and 22CT418.  Defendant must report by end of business day 09/16/2022 to sign his bond.

11:21 AM; Case called for Initial appearance. Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas N Lacy appeared by Zoom video.All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Court advises of right to an attorney. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Court will order the defendant report no later then the end of business day on 09/16/2022 to sign his bond.  Court will adjourn for plea and sentencing to tag along with the defendant's other matters.  Court will order the defendant appear in person for the next court date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:34 AM Defendant Thomas N Lacy not in court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.  Court notes the defendant currently is set for the date of September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am for a status of counsel on cases 22CT146 and 22CT418.  Court will set this matter over for an initial appearance before the Circuit Court Judge to tag along with the other matters.  Court ordered a warrant stayed until next court date.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
